page.title: 13FLOOD CONTROL -W.LEEDS
page.content: {THE FARNLEY VALLEY BALANCING RESERVOIR was built to prevent the beck flooding in Wortley -lower down the valley. The water is not for drinking. The earth dug out for the reservoir was used to build terraced playing fields nearby. A dam was built parallel to Tong Road. 16 holes in the dam control the water flow. In dry weather the reservoir contains about 12 million gallons and is less than 1 metre deep. In severe weather the reservoir can hold over 47 million gallons and be over 3 metres deep. From the dam you can look across to the three islands and down to the water birds below. Ducks, ducklings, swans, cygnets, coots, geese, gulls and other birds can be seen. Bushes are growing around the reservoir. There is a lot of rubbish in the reservoir. The very busy ring road runs by the south side.
